statement.tex: \text{Find a vector of magnitude 6 which is} \\ \text{perpendicular to both the vectors }\vector{2}{1}{2} \\ \text{and }\vector{4}{-1}{3}.

step.reason: \text{If two vectors are $\perp$ their dot product is zero.} \\ \begin{align} \therefore&(\vector{a}{b}{c})\cdot(\vector{2}{1}{2})=0, \\ \implies &2a+b+2c= 0 \\ \text{and }&(\vector{a}{b}{c}).(\vector{4}{-1}{3})=0 \\ \implies &4a-b+3c= 0 \end{align}

\ora{v}=\vector{a}{b}{c},\text{ and}|\ora{v}|=6 \\ \therefore {\bf a^2+b^2+c^2=6^2=36} \\ 2a+b+2c=4a-b+3c= 0 \\ \therefore {\bf a=-\dfrac{5}{6}c, b=-\dfrac{1}{3}c} \\ \text{Combining the above results, we get,} \\ {\bf \ora{v}=\dfrac{6}{\sqrt{65}}(\vector{-5}{-2}{6})}
